Constructor Detail

BaseEngine

Method Detail

startProcess

public Process startProcess(Graph graph)
Description copied from interface: Engine
Given a Graph, creates a new Process executing that graph. A NodeToken will be generated on each start nodes (determined by Graph.getStartNodes()), and these NodeTokens will be executed. If the graph does not contain Nodes which go into a wait state, the Process returned will be completed.

Specified by:
startProcess in interface Engine
Parameters:
graph - The Graph to execute.
Returns:
A Process executing the given Graph.

startProcess

public void startProcess(Process process)
Description copied from interface: Engine
Sometimes it is desirable to separate process creation from starting execution of the process. For example, one may wish to set some variables into the process environment before starting execution. startProcess will generate a new NodeToken on each start node contained in the given process.

Specified by:
startProcess in interface Engine
Parameters:
process - The process on which to begin execution.

cancelProcess

public void cancelProcess(Process process)
Description copied from interface: Engine
Cancels the given process. The process state is set to ProcessState.PendingCancel.

Specified by:
cancelProcess in interface Engine
Parameters:
process - The process to cancel

isProcessEndAsynchronous

public boolean isProcessEndAsynchronous()
Description copied from interface: Engine
Competes and cancels may be performed synchronously or asynchronously. If synchronous, Engine.finalizeComplete(Process) and Engine.finalizeCancel(Process) will be called directly by the engine. If asynchronous, Engine.doAsyncComplete(Process) and Engine.doAsyncCancel(Process) will be called. These methods should be overridden by subclasses. The subclass with then be responsible for calling the appropriate finalize method when ready.
If this method returns false, the process will never enter the ProcessState.PendingCancel and ProcessState.PendingCompletion states.
Returns false by default.

Specified by:
isProcessEndAsynchronous in interface Engine
Returns:
True if complete and cancel should be performed asynchronously.

doAsyncCancel

public void doAsyncCancel(Process process)
Description copied from interface: Engine
Hook for subclasses to set up asynchronous cancellation if desired. The process will be in state ProcessState.PendingCancel.
Only invoked if Engine.isProcessEndAsynchronous() returns true;

Specified by:
doAsyncCancel in interface Engine
Parameters:
process - The process being canceled.

doAsyncComplete

public void doAsyncComplete(Process process)
Description copied from interface: Engine
Hook for subclasses to set up asynchronous completion if desired. The process will be in state ProcessState.PendingCompletion.
Only invoked if Engine.isProcessEndAsynchronous() returns true;

Specified by:
doAsyncComplete in interface Engine
Parameters:
process - The process being completed.

completeExecution

public void completeExecution(NodeToken token,
                              String arcName)
Description copied from interface: Engine
Continues execution of a process in a wait state. If a call to Node.execute(Engine, NodeToken) does not contain a call to Engine.completeExecution(NodeToken, String), then execution of the graph will halt at that point. This is generally referred to as a wait state. It may happen, for example, if the action represented by that node must be done by a human or some external system.
When the external system has determined that the Node has completed its work, it should invoke this method to continue executing the process.
If the token belongs to a process which is _not_ in state ProcessState.Executing this call will return immediately.

Specified by:
completeExecution in interface Engine
Parameters:
token - The NodeToken to resume execution on
arcName - The name of the Arc (or arcs, as more than one Arc can have the same name) to generate ArcTokens on.
